item.title: Mo add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description:
"We came out here to find the American Dream, and now that we're right in the vortex you want to quit ... You must realize that we've found the main nerve."
I know," he said. "That's what gives me the Fear." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Mo add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Mo add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Mo add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "Every normal man must be tempted, at times, to spit on his hands, hoist the black flag, and begin slitting throats." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Mo add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "Few tasks are more like the torture of Sisyphus than housework, with its endless repetition: the clean becomes soiled, the soiled is made clean, over and over, day after day." -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: Mo add a quote by lewis carroll
item.description: "If you drink much from a bottle marked 'poison' it is certain to disagree with you sooner or later." -- lewis carroll

item.title: Mo add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!" -- John Waters
